column2:
Join #TheShowMustBePaused x @passtheauxparty as we enjoy a night of music in virtual celebration of Black Culture!

Come ready to sing and dance share your most iconic songs in a head to head competition. RSVP now because slots WILL fill up fast. 

https://t.co/r6qY75eDuC https://t.co/MtGs42XP0M

"We work so much that work has become our work life and home life but the most productive ppl are those who live-they do go the basketball games, they do carve out "me" time & time for reflection." - Skip @mixcom

On self-care & mental health: "I used 2 think mental health was a weakness for those who cannot handle it.  That is the farthest from the truth. Particularly for Black men: it's ok 2 feel a certain way but let's talk about it. It's so critically important." -Tony @MrTonyCornelius

On self-care & mental health: "I've rediscovered fitness as a lifestyle.  I'm also leaning into my faith & practicing w/ intention.  Working in our industry there is no time unless you MAKE the time." - Azim @blackarigold
"It's hard to be a Black man in America & equally as hard to raise Black boys in America" - Brandon @B_Clutch

On raising a Black son during these times: "I'm having open dialogue with my son - about his color.  He's starting to understand. I'm teaching him that we judge ppl on their character & if they are a good person." - Max @maxg_tv

On Being a Girl Dad: "The messaging you're getting in the music is not how you should be treated.  They have myself and their uncles and a village of men to protect them from what is going on the lyrics." - Azim @blackarigold
On Work life balance & post-pandemic: "I've become a better father, communicator and businessman in this pandemic." - Tony @MrTonyCornelius

On Work life balance & post-pandemic: "I realized how much time I was placing into things that didn't fulfill me...I valued this time to be with my family.  Now that the world is opening back up, I'm going to be moving differently." Brandon @B_Clutch
On Work life balance & post-pandemic: "There is a reason why many ppl quit their job last year; and not b/c they hated their jobs, but b/c they found out what was more important" - Skip @mixcom
RT @BiancaEnRogue: A year after @pausetheshow‚Äôs launch, I spoke to #TheShowMustBePaused co-founders Brianna Agyemang & Jamila Thomas about‚Ä¶

‚ÄúBlack Men in Music: Spotlight on the Face of Fatherhood‚Äù with @tweetsbybri , @onlyakeem, @MrTonyCornelius, Su-Rmi Givens, @mixcom, Kelli Andrews, Max Gayle, Jamila T, and The Show Must Be Paused.. Tomorrow, Jun 23 at 8:00 PM EDT on @clubhouse! https://t.co/s3lRpLFsRF
RT @CAU: #CAUSalutes activist & executive Jamila Thomas CAU‚Äô07! As Vice President of Artist Marketing @motown, Thomas oversees marketing st‚Ä¶
@helloBOSCO ‚ÄúThe best advice I can give is to just go into motherhood with intention. Manifest the family, career, and life that you want.‚Äù #tsmbp4her #theshowmustbepaused
@TimeZoneInt  It took me a long time to realize that ‚ÄúNo.‚Äù was a complete sentence. #TSMBP4her

@iamwhitneygayle I work with a lot of millennials. It felt like there was no one who can relate to my direct circumstances of being a mom. I couldn't be as celebratory about being a mom.......I would compare myself. I had to really lean on my people for support. #tsmbp4her

Kelli: 
‚ÄúThere‚Äôs no blue print for me. I am the first & only mother one our team. So for me it‚Äôs all about leaning on my tribe, my family, and my husband. ‚Äú #tsmbp4her #theshowmustbepaused

@Wish_Kid_Jones
‚ÄúAs a mother, you go home to another job. And as black women, it‚Äôs assumed that we are super women ‚Äî even if we are tired. You need a tribe.‚Äù #tsmbp4her #theshowmustbepaused

@hellobosco ‚ÄúI celebrate myself by giving gratitude. Gratitude beget abundance.I learned to reframe my thought process of what success looks like for me. Now it's just a quiet moment with my baby. I changed my perspective it‚Äôs helped so much.‚Äù #tsmbp4Her #theshowmustbepaused

@lynnmscott ‚ÄúI learned to make every moment count. I was constantly forgiving myself. As a working mom, that guilt can be crippling. Once I started forgiving myself ..I got to a better place where it became about quality time, not quantity time. ‚Äú #tsmbp4her #theshowmustbepaused

@TimeZoneInt ‚ÄúTheres a big difference between having a child & raising a child...I was a mother before entering the music industry & I had to make sure that my bosses knew that I was a package deal. ‚Äú #tsmbp4her #theshowmustbepaused

@iamwhitneygayle 1 of the benefits from this situation is that I have could take a year w my son. I don‚Äôt know what it‚Äôs like to not be w/him. I feel for those new mothers that have to make decisions to balance life having a new born & having to work. #tsmbp4her #tsmbp

@hellobosco On the pandemic: The universe is putting us in this space to work on ourselves. I learned the  accountability will come from my end with placing my own boundaries.  #TSMBP4her #theshowmustbepaused
#TSMBP4Her

@Wish_Kid_Jones 
‚ÄúThe pandemic has highlighted places I was not paying attention to. I‚Äôm coming out of it, looking to keep my accountability. B/c you had to sit w yourself. Am I honoring that my family comes 1st , my lives work & purpose? To me that brought about an awakening. ‚Äú
RT @pausetheshow: Don‚Äôt forget to join us today at 8 PM ET on @Clubhouse for ‚ÄúBlack Moms In Music: Can We Have It All?‚Äù with @tweetsbybri,‚Ä¶

Don‚Äôt forget to join us today at 8 PM ET on @Clubhouse for ‚ÄúBlack Moms In Music: Can We Have It All?‚Äù with @tweetsbybri, Kelli Andrews, @helloBOSCO, Jamila T, @TimeZoneInt, @iamwhitneygayle, Wish Simpson, @lynnmscott, Su-Rmi Givens & @GlowMaven https://t.co/fQcQNzR1oy

We‚Äôre discussing ‚ÄúBlack Moms In Music: Can We Have It All?‚Äù with Kelli Andrews, @helloBOSCO, Jamila T, @TimeZoneInt, @iamwhitneygayle, Wish Simpson, @lynnmscott, Su-Rmi Givens, and #TSMBP - Wednesday, Jun 9 at 8:00 PM EDT on @clubhouse. Join us! https://t.co/fQcQNzR1oy
RT @pandoramusic: On June 2, 2020 #TheShowMustBePaused was established. One year later, and the work isn‚Äôt done yet. @pausetheshow co-found‚Ä¶

STILL PAUSED. Today marks the 1 year anniversary of the day the music industry stood still and TSMBP was born. The goal was always to hold accountable those that profited from black people and black music - this some of the work we‚Äôve done in the past year. #theshowmustbepaused https://t.co/CqPqE6jFDj
We‚Äôre live! Click the link below to join us https://t.co/Vyhoyuzqkx
Closing out #WomensHistoryMonth with this amazing panel! Register here: https://t.co/aRs9mvjVmx https://t.co/FzaFfcw0zz
Have you registered? Don‚Äôt miss this great conversation with @TTowalame @jeaninemclean @SilenceTheShame Tashana Ventura, Joi Brown and Alexis Cooper. Link in bio! https://t.co/5qzuHx1mxk
#TSMBP4her Wednesday 3/31 @5pmET to register click the link in the bio

We are honored to celebrate Women‚Äôs History Month with a phenomenal group of women as panelist for the ‚ÄúWomen In Entertainement: Building Sisterhood‚Äù. Join us for a much needed convo. Registration link in bio! https://t.co/8s3oAskX2T

Thank you to TSMBP career fair team, all of the panelists, moderators and viewers for making the first #Books2Boardroom a success! Over 1.3M ppl have tuned in . If you missed a panel, all panels from the series can be watched here on our Twitter. https://t.co/i1zyPOAH88
Motown Promotes Ethiopia Habtemariam to Chairman/CEO | Billboard https://t.co/3BdhqHV7Bi
RT @shesaid_so: We're celebrating Black Execs and Artists in America Making Music Moves ‚ú®‚ú® as American Black History Month draws to a close‚Ä¶
"Stick up for yourself & believe in yourself. Speak up and don't be afraid of hearing no." - Su-Rmi Givens, UMG #Books2Boardroom
The HR portion of the panel is starting. Learn more about how to get your foot in the door! Moderated by Su-Rmi Givens (@JahSeoul) from Universal Music Group. #Books2Boardroom
Advice: "Don't be afraid to try new things. Feel the fear and do it anyway. You will get through it and you will be okay." - Tanece Moore, Atlantic Records #Books2Boardroom

"Don't be timid. Hit the ground running & go for it. Networking across will be so crucial & sometimes it's ok to just take a deep breath and just be you." - Gabriella Andrean, RCA Records #Books2Boardroom

"Don't worry about about anyone above you. Pay attention to people beside you. Those are the people who will be in the trenches with you. It's important to build with people at your level who will grow with you." - Khlarissa Agee, Motown/QC #Books2Boardroom

"What's important to me is passion & drive. Showing how much you want to be here & that you've researched. Once you're here continue to ask questions & show that you understand what's happening and that you're eager to grow." - Noelle Charles, The Orchard #Books2Boardroom
When looking for an intern: "Punctuality...I like someone that is on time or even early. Somebody that is hungry." - Gabriella Andrean, RCA Records #Books2Boardroom
"Great communication, organization and resourcefulness are all skills you need to have." - Kianna Baptiste, Asylum Records #Books2Boardroom
Stay tuned! Our final panel will start in a few minutes. #Books2Boardroom

"There's no definitive job description of A&R. At some point I've played a part in every area throughout the process. Every single component & aspect is crucial to the big picture...I look at it from above & focus on execution from A to Z." - Steve-O, Republic #Books2Boardroom

"If you have the time & resources and are serious about being an A&R, go out there and get an artist. Cultivate and work with an artist you are genuinely passionate about." - Norva Denton, Warner Records #Books2Boardroom

"If you're going to send a cold email, research the person. Get to know the artist & projects they are working on. It will help when you are looking to actually get a response." - Lindsey Lanier, Motown Records #Books2Boardroom
"It's all about creating value. Investing and building your value will be your greatest resource in order to get through." - Steve-O Carless, Republic Records #Books2Boardroom

"How do you get a busy person to respond? Offer to take something off their plate. Ask to intern, study what's going on before reaching out to people. Be intentional when you reach out." - Nikisha Bailey, APG #Books2Boardroom

"I had 2 jobs while working my internship at the studio. I had to prove a point, I wanted them to see my dedication & work ethic. So I had to miss out on a few things but I don't regret it because I love what I do." - Sammye Scott, Atlantic. #Books2Boardroom
All of our A&R panelists agree - sacrifice is KEY to succeeding in the music business. #Books2Boardroom
RT @JahSeoul: Looking forward to moderating and closing out this wonderful series with insight from leading HR professionals in the music i‚Ä¶
@Racheezay You‚Äôll be able to watch her on Twitter
@edward_fequiere You‚Äôll be able to view it here on twitter

We‚Äôre closing out our #Books2Boardroom series with 3 panels tomorrow! Catch our A&R panel at 5 PM ET, our Coordinators panel at 6 PM ET and our HR panel at 6:30 PM ET! #TheShowMustBePaused https://t.co/6PtwSE8Uu3
On keeping your online profiles up to date : ‚ÄúIf you don‚Äôt take yourself seriously nobody else is. ‚Äú - @oldmanebro #Books2Boardroom
‚ÄúEveryone has the ability to be a storyteller. If you‚Äôre passionate about it and hone your skills, people will find you.‚Äù - @thedw #Books2Boardroom
‚ÄúI have been the only woman and only black woman in many rooms ..for me it‚Äôs important that I stay true to who I am , use my voice and make sure that I am heard ‚Äú - @TheDW

‚ÄúOn creative collaboration: We show up where the artist is. We expand on what‚Äôs personal to them and fit that into the story Apple Music is trying to tell. Doing this helps the content resonate more.‚Äù -Sydney Brown 
#Books2Boardroom
‚ÄúYour very difference can be the lane to an opportunity to open doors and create the opportunity for others to come ‚Äú - Sydney Brown #Books2Boardroom
‚ÄúI have been the only woman and only black woman in many rooms for me it‚Äôs important that I stay true to who I am , use my voice and making sure that I am heard ‚Äú - @TheDW #Books2Boardroom

How do you navigate in your role on a day to day ?‚Äù We lean into each other and the teams working these projects we have to use our resources and be flexible as things change ...‚Äú -Sydney Brown #Books2Boardroom

Interested in learning how the role of visual content in music w/ @AppleMusic? Check out the #Books2Boardroom series The Role of Visual Content in Music moderated by @oldmanebro  https://t.co/xWFLPKtIkv

To College grads: "Jobs are scarce in radio now,u can always start a podcast.I've hired someone from a podcast who is now on a syndicated show. Network with ppl on linkedin.¬†Jobs are about who you know.¬†There are videos that show you how to stand out in interviews." - @colbycolb

To college grads: "Make sure you really do love music, if you don't, find the aspect of what you think your skill set could be to add benefit to the company.¬† Also, intern, intern, intern! That is the genesis of your relationship building." - @samthehypebeast #Books2Boardroom

To aspiring Radio personalities: "You have to listen, be able to take in constructive criticism.¬† If u aren't able to listen, it can end your career. Realize that your time and your moment will come as long as you keep learning and putting in the work." @TTTorrez #Books2Boardroom
‚ÄúYou can not negate putting in the work and realizing your time and opportunity will come if you continue to be patient and put in the work.‚Äù - @TTTorrez #BookstoBoardroom

To aspiring talent: "It‚Äôs very easy to believe your own hype. Talent can sometimes have a peanut gallery around them. Make sure u have ppl around u at every stage of your career who can give it to u straight so u can grow and help u elevate to a whole new stratosphere.‚Äù - Thea M.

‚ÄúOne of my greatest accomplishments is the story of Kendrick Lamar I was there from day one - going from something that was popping in Compton to him becoming a super star ..‚Äù - @KeinonTheMaven #Books2Boardroom

Interested in working in music and radio? Kicking off #Books2Boardroom Series with Radio Promotion Panel moderated by @chrisgreenBK from Capitol Records.

Make sure to tweet us your questions using #Books2Boardroom https://t.co/vFyrPZhbs6

Join us for our final week of #Books2Boardroom kicking off tomorrow with our Apple Music panel at 5 PM ET + our Radio panel at 6 PM ET! Check out our amazing panelist üëèüèæ You don‚Äôt want to miss this one ! Registration link in the bio. https://t.co/UjVM5g1qmA

Just wrapped up another great panel! Thank you @Mufasa617 @njndure @itsohcay @kristinjenee. We‚Äôll be back Tuesday for our Radio Promotion, and The Role of Visual Content in Music Panels #Books2Boardroom
On finding mentors: ‚ÄúWhen that person shows in your life don‚Äôt be afraid to hit them up. Just make sure to keep those relationships and stay consistent.‚Äù - @itsohcay #Books2Boardroom
On being a great assistant: ‚ÄúThinking strategically around everything is so clutch. Understand the situation, read the room, and how to respond to that.‚Äù - @kristinjenee #Books2Boardroom
On 2021: ‚ÄúI‚Äôm excited to see more Black people on set. I know a lot of companies are making internal changes. I would love to walk on set and see us.‚Äù -@itsohcay #Books2Boardroom
"Don‚Äôt compare yourself to anyone else and trust the process." - @njndure #books2boardroom
Advice to your younger self: ‚ÄúCalm down & don‚Äôt over think. You have the tools to get through it. One step at a time. This wont be an issue anymore tomorrow.‚Äù - @kristinjenee #Books2Boardroom

On working during the pandemic: ‚ÄúI had to take a back seat & strategize. I had a period of where I was cold hitting people. I started working smarter. Hit your girl friend. Hit your guy friend for the connection. That‚Äôs been my saving grace.‚Äù - @itsohcay #Books2Boardroom
On our new normal: ‚ÄúThere‚Äôs no right answer. Any crazy idea you have, now is the time to pitch it because we are ALL just trying to figure it out.‚Äù - @Mufasa617 #Books2Boardroom

On our new normal:
‚ÄúIt‚Äôs forced everyone to be a little more creative. We can‚Äôt rely on a tour or live experience. How do we make this impactful for the artist & brand. It‚Äôs forced us to rethink how we approach it.‚Äù 
- @kristinjenee #Books2Boardroom
On brand partnership: "when all of the of those things are aligned: opportunity, person and product, it's a pretty much seamless."  - @njndure #Books2Boardroom
"I always look at people brand partnerships like a swiss army knife. You have to know a little bit about everything to get the job done." - @Mufasa617 #Books2Boardroom

‚ÄúThe brand must understand the artist. Not every campaign is cookie cutter. The brand must be flexible and cater to that artist or talent to make a good brand partnership‚Äù - @ItsOhCay #Books2Boardroom

Interested in learning how to get a start in music brand partnerships & product placements? Check out the #Books2Boardroom Series Brands Partnership & Product Placement Panel moderated by @Mufasa617 from RCA Records!  #Books2Boardroom https://t.co/MF8RnONJEN
Brand Partnerships + Product Placement panel up next! https://t.co/Og0GF6K49z
On getting into the industry: ‚ÄúI‚Äôm real persistent and real patient. I‚Äôm down to stick it out to get to my end goal. Keep hope alive‚Äù - @fatman_slim #Books2Boardroom
‚ÄúI had to be selfless until I could be selfish. I needed experience so I had to do what could get me in the door‚Äù - @brandonjinx #Books2Boardroom
‚ÄúMy compass would be my mom I run everything by her. I come from a religious family... If it‚Äôs a project or subject matter that I can‚Äôt show them I won‚Äôt shoot it.‚Äú - Child #Books2Boardroom
‚ÄúIf the opportunity is coming in, that‚Äôs a blessing. That means I‚Äôm doing something right.‚Äù @antbluejr #Books2Boardroom

‚ÄúI try to separate work from passion but I‚Äôm passionate about what I do so sometimes it‚Äôs hard to separate. Work life balance is important which I‚Äôm working on‚Äù - @fatman_slim #Books2Boardroom
‚ÄúAll creative businesses should come from passion first ‚Äú - @bwrightous #Books2Boardroom
‚ÄúWhat I wear on Monday I want to wear on Saturday . Meaning I didn‚Äôt want to change who I was for a 9-5. I want to be who I am all the time .‚Äù - @brandonjinx #Books2Boardroom
‚ÄúExplore everything & get rid of the bad stuff you aren‚Äôt feeling and add it to what you want to do next‚Äù - @antbluejr
‚ÄúThe same amount of energy you spend creating a project, you have to have the same energy in creating a plan around it‚Äù - @bwrightous #Books2Boardroom
On staying creative: ‚ÄúSometimes you have to unplug & look at something different.‚Äù - Child. #Books2Boardroom

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs been a lot of women and mentors in my life who end up being the loudest in the room and betting it all on me. It‚Äôs always important to have that one person who will help you kick the door in‚Äù - Child #Books2Boardroom
‚ÄúIf you find someone that believes in you, build that relationship. The knowledge they give to you.. whether it‚Äôs a couple words or an opportunity is valuable‚Äù - @bwrightous #Books2Boardroom
